decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, while also maintaining tempo with Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats. It utilizes efficient removal like Fatal Push and Snuff Out to maintain board presence. Key cards like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide powerful win conditions. The deck aims to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and close out the game quickly with its threats, all while efficiently managing resources and staying ahead in the game.

The deck focuses on quickly getting out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience to cheat them onto the battlefield. It also includes protection like Force of Will and Veil of Summer to ensure your combo goes off successfully. Using cards like Ponder and Brainstorm, the deck aims to set up the perfect hand to execute its game-winning combo as early as possible, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures before they can react effectively.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards and mana sources to generate a high storm count in order to cast powerful spells like Tendrils of Agony or Song of Creation for a game-winning combo. This is achieved through the use of rituals, fast mana sources, and card draw spells like Echo of Eons. Burning Wish is used to tutor for specific cards from the sideboard, offering flexibility in finding answers or additional combo pieces. Cabal Therapy helps disrupt the opponent's strategy while also enabling graveyard synergies with cards like Gaea's Will.

The main concept of this UR Aggro Legacy deck is to quickly and aggressively attack the opponent with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes cards like Brazen Borrower and Unholy Heat for removal and tempo advantage. Wasteland is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Mishra's Bauble helps with card selection and filling up the graveyard for cards like Murktide Regent. The deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to use artifacts, particularly Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, to generate mana quickly and cast powerful spells like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Pinnacle Emissary. By utilizing cards such as Lotus Petal and Mishra's Bauble alongside Force of Will for protection, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive playstyle. Additionally, Chalice of the Void and Sink into Stupor are included to disrupt opponents' strategies, while Urza's Bauble provides card advantage. The deck combines artifact synergies with aggressive tempo plays to create a unique and powerful strategy.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on deploying aggressive Eldrazi creatures quickly and disrupting opponents with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. The deck aims to control the battlefield with cards like Chalice of the Void and Kozilek's Command, while utilizing powerful lands like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple for mana acceleration. The deck also includes utility lands like Eye of Ugin and Wasteland to further disrupt opponents' game plans. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm opponents with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their strategies with disruptive spells and lands.

Utilize powerful graveyard reanimation spells and fast mana acceleration to cheat large creatures into play, disrupting the opponent's hand and board with discard spells. The goal is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful threats like Griselbrand, Archon of Cruelty, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then bring them back into play for a game-winning combo. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures before they have a chance to respond, utilizing its graveyard synergy and speed to outpace the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on generating fast and explosive combos using cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Infernal Tutor to cast powerful spells like Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony. It includes protection cards like Duress and Veil of Summer to disrupt opponents, as well as cards like Wishclaw Talisman for additional tutor options. The goal is to efficiently build up storm count and win the game in one big turn with a flurry of spells before the opponent can respond. The deck excels at quickly assembling the combo pieces and overwhelming the opponent with a lethal storm.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to control the game via disruption and removal, while maintaining card advantage through powerful draw spells and card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also seeks to lock opponents out of the game with cards like Back to Basics and Force of Will, while also being able to adapt to different board states with versatile removal options like Prismatic Ending. The deck is designed to out-value opponents over the long game and disrupt their game plan effectively.

This deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost, aggressive creatures and using counter spells and removal to control the board. The key strategy involves using cards like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent to apply pressure early on while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Wasteland. The deck also includes efficient card draw and filtering with Ponder, Mishra's Bauble, and Brainstorm to maintain momentum and find key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to outpace opponents with a fast and disruptive tempo strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with as many creatures as possible, utilizing various spells and accelerants to achieve this goal. By casting spells like Dark Ritual and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck aims to play out its entire hand, eventually leading to a game-winning combo involving sacrificing creatures and casting cards like Thassa's Oracle or Goblin Charbelcher. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a barrage of spells and creatures, ultimately achieving victory through a powerful combo finish.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly lock down the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan by utilizing cards like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Magus of the Moon. By playing powerful threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf alongside efficient mana acceleration cards, this deck aims to apply pressure and close out the game swiftly with cards like Sundering Eruption and Fury. Additionally, the inclusion of Urza's Saga and The One Ring provides additional versatility and utility to combat a variety of strategies in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to be able to drop powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game. It also utilizes tools like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith to tutor for the necessary pieces. Control elements like Collector Ouphe and Sylvan Safekeeper help protect the board while creatures like Allosaurus Shepherd and Fiend Artisan provide additional utility. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast mana acceleration and impactful creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as counterspells, removal spells, and land disruption to keep the opponent's threats in check while establishing its own board presence with Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Kaldra Compleat. Card advantage is also a key component of the deck, with card selection provided by Ponder, Brainstorm, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Additionally, the inclusion of unique cards like Quantum Riddler and Meticulous Archive adds another layer of versatility and resource management to outmaneuver opponents in a variety of situations.

This deck aims to quickly assemble a combo using cards that allow for explosive mana generation and graveyard manipulation to ultimately win the game without the need for traditional gameplay elements like creatures and combat. The goal is to quickly play and resolve key combo pieces that will allow for a decisive victory before the opponent has a chance to respond. It heavily relies on non-creature spells to set up the win condition and protect it from disruption.

The deck focuses on using Cloudpost lands to ramp up mana quickly, allowing for powerful plays with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Eldrazi Confluence. It also includes a variety of control elements with counterspells like Force of Will and removal like Kozilek's Command. The deck can generate a large amount of mana to cast big threats like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and The One Ring, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Disruptor Flute. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and creatures while controlling the board.
